name: Fraud, Scam, and Deceptive Practices
description: We protect users and businesses from being deceived out of money, property or personal information. We remove content that purposefully employs deceptive means - willful misrepresentation, stolen information, exaggerated claims - to scam or defraud users for commercial or financial gain.
corePrinciple: Content must NOT facilitate or offer fraudulent goods/services, coordinate fraudulent activities, or use deceptive tactics to scam users for commercial/financial gain. Awareness raising and condemnation of fraud is allowed.

categories.name: Fake, Forged, Counterfeit or Stolen Documents
categories.description: False, altered, misleading or inauthentic documents for defrauding third parties
documentTypes: Identification documents (Government IDs, Passports, Driver's licenses, Visas, Green cards, Work permits, License plates)
Official documents (Business documents, Utility bills, Pay slips, Birth/Death/Marriage certificates, Medical certificates, Vaccine certificates, Military certificates)
Financial documents (Cheques, Invoices, Receipts, Bank statements)
Educational documents (Fake diplomas, Degrees, Transcripts, Professional certificates, TOEFL, IELTS, GRE, GMAT)
legitimacySignals: Informal payment (unofficial channels, personal accounts, digital apps)
Avoiding regular requirement (obtain license without exam, visa without application)
Suspicious production language (produce, create, make, edit documents)
Authenticity claims (100% original, authentic, real and registered, scannable)
Counterfeiting imagery (stacks with rubber bands, gloves, examination against light)
Counterfeit terminology (frozen dollar, G5, A+++, Grade A notes)
Counterfeiting tools (Photoshop, scanners, printers, laminators, Teslin paper)
exceptions: Awareness on risks of forging documents
Legitimate prop cash with distinguishing features (FOR MOTION PICTURE PURPOSES)

categories.name: Fake, Forged or Stolen Goods and Services
categories.description: Physical or digital products created through deceptive means

subcategories.name: Fake, Forged or Stolen Financial Instruments
subcategories.description: Credit/debit/prepaid cards used for unauthorized purchases
signals: Carding keywords (dumps, cc, cashout, clone card)
Blank white cards with chip and handwritten info

subcategories.name: Fake Reviews
subcategories.description: Ratings/reviews that artificially manipulate product reception
conditions: Solicitation, creation, sale, purchase or trade of reviews
Reviews in exchange for monetary/non-monetary compensation
Incentivizing reviews with discount, refund, free item
exceptions: Chances to win prizes for surveys/feedback
Compensated product testers sharing genuine experiences
Reviews with clear disclosure of incentives

subcategories.name: Stolen Goods and Services
subcategories.description: Physical or digital products with self-disclosure of being stolen

categories.name: Devices and Subscriptions Manipulated or Used Unauthorized
categories.description: Improper use of devices/subscriptions deviating from intended use

types.name: Jailbroken and Loaded Devices
examples: Firestick + (All channels, Fully loaded, Jailbroken, Updated)

unauthorizedSignals: Informal payment (social media payments, Zelle, CashApp, crypto)

categories.name: Personally Identifiable Information (PII) Fraud
categories.description: Solicitation, sale, purchase or trade of PII
piiTypes: National identification numbers (SSN, Passport Numbers, ITINs)
Immigration documents (green cards, work permits, visas)
otherPersonalInfo: Financial records (bank accounts, credit/debit card info)
School IDs with name + photo + ID number

categories.name: Products and Services Enabling Cheating
categories.description: Products helping users cheat on exams in deceptive manner
types: Exam proxy services (taking exams on behalf of user)
Future exam papers or answer sheets (NOT past exams)
Products enabling passing drug tests unauthorized
exceptions: Exam prep courses, study aids, flashcards

categories.name: Money Muling
categories.description: Victims unknowingly participating in money laundering via their accounts
indicators: Quick money in exchange for using bank account
Employment for accepting/transferring money to third parties
Digital payment accounts (PayPal, CashApp, Venmo, Zelle, Bitcoin, Chime)

categories.name: Money Laundering
categories.description: Disguising origin of illegally obtained money
indicators: SWIFT transfers (MT799, MT102, MT101, MT103, GPI)
Seeking bank accounts for receipt/transfer of cash
Terms: Loaders, Rippers, Flashers, Receivers in financial context

categories.name: Loan Fraud and Scam
categories.description: Offering guaranteed loans to deceive victims out of money/PII
primaryIndicators: Guarantee or near-guarantee of loan approval
Requiring advance fee to obtain loan
categories.implicitGuarantee: Loan approved without credit rating, collateral, or financial documentation
secondaryIndicators: Lack of terms and conditions (only contact details)
Unrealistic claims (immediate loan forgiveness, debt cancellation)

categories.name: Gambling Fraud and Scam
categories.description: Deceptive real money gambling services

subcategories.name: Social Casino Games (No Real Money)
subcategories.description: Games simulating gambling with no real money opportunity

secondaryIndicators: Match tips, coupon photos, money photos

categories.name: Investment or Financial Fraud and Scam
categories.description: Deceptive investment opportunities

subcategories.name: Get Rich Quick / Small to Large Investment
Money/Cash Flip
subcategories.description: Turn small sum into large through flipping/trick

secondaryIndicators: Binary trading, Forex trading, Cryptocurrency opportunities
Depictions of cash or large bank balances
High value items (expensive cars, planes, jewelry)

categories.name: Charity Fraud and Scam
categories.description: Deceptive charitable donation requests
requiredConditions: Claiming to collect money for charitable causes
AND one of: bank transfer/gift cards only, specific sum only, requests PII
secondaryIndicators: Urgency to send money (tomorrow, this week)

categories.name: Romance Fraud and Scam
categories.description: Establishing online romantic relationships to defraud
primaryIndicators: Seeking non-sexual companionship
Offering or asking for money in exchange
romanticSignals: Terms of endearment (baby, my love, darling)
Romantic aspirations (I long to meet you)
secondaryIndicators: Claims of wealth seeking someone to spoil

categories.name: Established Business/Entity Fraud and Scam
categories.description: Falsely claiming to represent established business
categories.condition: Falsely represents established entity AND violates another fraud/scam section
categories.note: Small local businesses NOT considered established

categories.name: Government Grant Fraud and Scam
categories.description: False promises of money from government grants
unrealisticClaims: Claim within short period (less than 1 day)
Money paid out in short period
Money can be spent any way

categories.name: Tangible, Spiritual or Illuminati Fraud and Scam
categories.description: Offering tangible rewards for spiritual/cult membership
primaryIndicators: Membership in association, cult, religious sect (Illuminati Brotherhood)
Using black magic, spells, magical items (lucky charms, amulets, potions, magic wallet)

categories.name: Insurance Fraud and Scam (Ghost Broking)
categories.description: Offering false, heavily discounted insurance
primaryIndicators: Request for up-front fee (admin fee, deposit)
Promises 30%+ savings vs conventional providers

categories.name: Job Fraud and Scam
categories.description: Deceptive job opportunities
primaryIndicators: Deceptive job opportunity (Temu, Shein, Walmart, Shopee without verified page)
Get Rich Quick job opportunity
Vague job opportunity (no company name + unclear requirements)
No job information, just references vacancy
WFH but job implies cannot WFH (WFH cleaner, WFH driver)
Salary offered in advance
Job guaranteed (100% guaranteed)
Advance fee before job granted
secondaryIndicators: Proof of payment (bank transfer, wage slip)
Unrelated images (woman posing for data entry job)

categories.name: Debt Relief and Credit Repair Fraud Scam
categories.description: Guaranteeing debt elimination or credit repair
primaryIndicators: Delete/eliminate debt or reduce by amount in set time
Stop/delete all debt collections or lawsuits
Forgive debt through 'new government program'
Delete credit info from reports or create new 'credit identity'

categories.name: Giveaway Fraud and Scam
categories.description: Guaranteed reward requiring suspicious actions

categories.name: Advance Fee Fraud and Scam
categories.description: Falsely promises money for up-front payment
secondaryIndicators: Large amount of money can be claimed
Claims to help reach stardom or wealth

categories.name: Misleading Health Practices
categories.description: False or misleading health claims or guarantees

subcategories.name: Instant Cure for Non-Life-Threatening Conditions
subcategories.requirement: Promise of instant or immediate effect

subcategories.name: Specific Results in Specific Time (No Disclaimer)
examples: Lose 5 inches off waist in 20 days
notViolating: Specific result without specific time (Lose 5 lbs)
Specific time without specific result (Get fit in two months)
With qualifying statement (Lose UP TO 5 lbs/week)

subcategories.name: Click-bait Tactics / Sensational Language
signals: tip, trick, secret, solution, truth, miracle
Doctors don't want you to know

categories.name: Condemnation and Awareness Raising
categories.description: Discussing fraud without promoting or revealing sensitive info
conditions: Does NOT reveal PII, future exam papers, or login credentials

sale_purchase: Payment methods (PayPal, CashApp, Venmo, Zelle, Bitcoin, gift cards)

labelHierarchy.label: FSDP > Fake, Forged, Counterfeit or Stolen Documents
FSDP > PII or Other Personal Information
FSDP > Investment or Financial Fraud and Scam
FSDP > Government Grant Fraud and Scam
FSDP > Tangible, Spiritual or Illuminati Fraud
FSDP > Debt Relief and Credit Repair Fraud
FSDP > Advance Fee Fraud and Scam
FSDP > Misleading Health > Weight Loss Context

exceptions.description: Content posted by entity with 'Verified' signal (for certain fraud types)
Raising awareness or educating others about fraud
Legitimate prop cash with distinguishing features
Past exams or answer keys (not future)
Legitimate product testers with genuine experiences
Offering internet service with bundled streaming

glossary.fraud_scam: Generating financial/personal benefit from others' money, goods or PII obtained through deceptive means
glossary.commercial_financial_gain: Act involving fraud where outcome is taking money, property, or anything of monetary/physical value
glossary.real_money: Currency that can buy goods/services in real world (USD, Euro, Bitcoin) - NOT in-game only currency
glossary.social_casino_games: Simulated gambling games with no opportunity to win real money
glossary.established_business: Business operating at national level+ (government, multinational, offices in 2+ regions)
glossary.tangible_rewards: Money, goods, or services with monetary value (cash, digital payments, crypto, goods, services)
glossary.pii: Information that uniquely identifies an individual
glossary.on_platform_engagement: Likes, shares, follows, comments, reactions, views, clicks, hashtag use on Facebook/Instagram
glossary.betting_manipulation: Collusion to manipulate gamble outcome to win wagers
glossary.sensationalist_language: Exaggerated health claims using words like miracle, secret, shocking, guaranteed cure

operationalGuidelines.requiresOneSignalInContent: At least one signal must be present in Content in Review
operationalGuidelines.contextCanConfirm: Signals from parent/context can confirm violation if related to content
operationalGuidelines.weightLossSpecificResults: Specific numeric result + specific numeric time = violation; either alone = no violation
